question.body: Which of the following veins does not have a corresponding artery associated with it?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The deep brachial vein is paired with the brachial artery.
Incorrect. The deep axillary vein is paired with the axillary artery.
Incorrect. The deep radial vein is paired with the radial artery.
Correct. The cephalic vein is a superficial vein that is not paired with a corresponding artery.

part.hint: Deep veins most commonly have corresponding arteries, while superficial veins do not.
